publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7158 Patrick Harvie: Crosshill Post Office—That the Parliament believes that the decision taken by the Post Office to move Crosshill Post Office on Victoria Road, Glasgow, to Cathcart Road, Glasgow, is regrettable, given what it considers to be the excellence of service, ease of access for pedestrians, better transport links and purpose-built building of the existing site; sympathises with those post office employees who are now uncertain of their job security; considers that too many of Scotland’s post offices are being closed down, and calls on the Post Office to take full account of the views of local users of Crosshill Post Office, many of whom, it believes, strongly oppose the proposed move. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7158 Crosshill Post Office (lodged on 5 October 2010) Bill Kidd*, Aileen Campbell*, Robin Harper*
S3M-7158 Crosshill Post Office (lodged on 5 October 2010) Sandra White*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-7158 Patrick Harvie: Crosshill Post Office—That the Parliament believes that the decision taken by the Post Office to move Crosshill Post Office on Victoria Road, Glasgow, to Cathcart Road, Glasgow, is regrettable, given what it considers to be the excellence of service, ease of access for pedestrians, better transport links and purpose-built building of the existing site; sympathises with those post office employees who are now uncertain of their job security; considers that too many of Scotland’s post offices are being closed down, and calls on the Post Office to take full account of the views of local users of Crosshill Post Office, many of whom, it believes, strongly oppose the proposed move. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson, Bill Kidd, Aileen Campbell, Robin Harper, Sandra White, Gil Paterson
